--------------A4F71840FFF898F342379A35
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8; format=flowed

This week's database news

#224 =E2=80=94 October 5, 2018

=09

Read on the Web <https://dbweekly.com/issues/224>

Database Weekly

<https://dbweekly.com/link/53784/85a4c1edbc>

A Brief History of High Availability=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53784/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 A high level look =
at how=20
distributed databases have historically handled partial failures and=20
what =E2=80=98high availability=E2=80=99 means and looks like in real ter=
ms.

Sean Loiselle

Redis Speeds Towards a Multi-Model Future=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53785/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 Redis is best know=
n as a=20
very fast key-value store, but there=E2=80=99s more to it than that espec=
ially=20
if Redis Labs gets its way. Here=E2=80=99s an update on where Redis is at=
 right now.

Datanami

<https://dbweekly.com/link/53786/85a4c1edbc>

Actionable Insights into Your Path to Production=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53786/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 Want to deliver fa=
ster?=20
Want to recover from failures more quickly? Want to improve your cycle=20
time? Use GoCD with its analytics plugin to improve your software=20
delivery with actionable metrics. Sign up for a trial.

GoCD sponsor

Oracle Releases Autonomous NoSQL Database Cloud Service=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53787/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 This video=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53788/85a4c1edbc> explains the basic idea.=20
Essentially it=E2=80=99s a scalable, fully managed DynamoDB-esque databas=
e that=20
supports JSON, table and key-value datatypes, with flexible transaction=20
guarantees.

Oracle

SQL as an API Language? <https://dbweekly.com/link/53789/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=
=94=20
Within a write up about his Datasette=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53790/85a4c1edbc> project (a tool to create=20
JSON APIs for SQLite databases) Simon reflected on GraphQL=E2=80=99s abil=
ity to=20
query data and how SQL could essentially be used for the same thing.

Simon Willison

RediSQL: Bringing SQL to Redis=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53791/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 A Redis module emb=
eds an=20
SQLite database into your Redis instance. There=E2=80=99s an open source=20
version, plus a pro version with more features.

Team Dhrubok

Tuning Amazon RDS for MySQL with Performance Insights=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53792/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 Amazon RDS Perform=
ance=20
Insights brings a tuning interface to Amazon RDS to help you discover=20
and investigate performance issues.

Jeremiah Wilton and Szymon Komendera (AWS)

Sequence Caching: Oracle vs. Postgres=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53793/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 Sequence caching i=
s when=20
a database pre-generates sequence values in advance making them quicker=20
to provide when needed.

Don Seiler

Why The European Space Agency Uses Postgres=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53794/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 A look into the wo=
rld of=20
space exploration and time-series and geospatial data and how it all=20
comes together in the ESA=E2=80=99s use case for Postgres and TimescaleDB=
..

Andrew Staller

pgCenter: Stress Free Postgres Stats=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53795/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 An open-source CLI=
 admin=20
tool for working with Postgres activity statistics.

Alexey Lesovsky

Awesome MongoDB: A Curated Set of MongoDB Resources=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53796/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 Over 100 curated l=
inks to=20
MongoDB tutorials, libraries, articles, etc.

Guillaume Gelin

ClusterControl - Get Three Months Free with an Annual Contract=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53797/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 The only database=20
management system you=E2=80=99ll need to take control of your open source=
=20
database infrastructure.

Severalnines sponsor

PL/R: R Procedural Language Support for Postgres=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53798/85a4c1edbc> =E2=80=94 PL/R lets you writ=
e=20
Postgres functions using R, the popular statistical computing language.=20
A new version <https://dbweekly.com/link/53799/85a4c1edbc> has just been=20
released which introduces Postgres 11 support.

Joseph E. Conway

Introducing HaloDB, A Fast, Embedded Key-Value Storage Engine Written in=20
Java <https://dbweekly.com/link/53800/85a4c1edbc>

Yahoo Engineering

tic-tac-toe.sql: Tic Tac Toe Implemented in SQL=20
<https://dbweekly.com/link/53801/85a4c1edbc>

Dvir Volk


A *Cooperpress <https://cooperpress.com/>* publication.

Change your email address=20
<https://dbweekly.com/edit_subscription/85a4c1edbc> or Stop getting this=20
newsletter <https://dbweekly.com/leave/85a4c1edbc>

=C2=A9 Cooper Press Ltd =C2=B7 Fairfield Enterprise Centre, Louth, LN11 0=
LS,=20
United Kingdom

                            style=3D"text-decoration: none;
                            color:&#xA;&#xA; #478dda;
                            border-bottom-width: 1px&#xA;&#xA;
                            !important; border-bottom-color:
                            #ddd&#xA;&#xA; !important;
                            border-bottom-style: solid&#xA;&#xA;
                            !important;" moz-do-not-send=3D"true">Oracle
                            Releases Autonomous NoSQL Database Cloud
                            Service</a></span> =E2=80=94 <a
                          href=3D"https://dbweekly.com/link/53788/85a4c1e=
dbc"
                          style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:&#xA;
                          #478dda;&#xA; border-bottom-width: 1px&#xA;
                          !important;&#xA; border-bottom-color:
                          #ddd&#xA; !important;&#xA;
                          border-bottom-style: solid&#xA; !important;"
                          moz-do-not-send=3D"true">This video</a> explain=
s
                        the basic idea. Essentially it=E2=80=99s a scalab=
le,
                        fully managed DynamoDB-esque database that
                        supports JSON, table and key-value datatypes,
                        with flexible transaction guarantees.</p>
                      <p class=3D"name" style=3D"color: #5a5a5a;&#xA;&#xA=
;
                        font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                        -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-s=
erif;&#xA;&#xA;
                        font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.55em;&#xA;&#xA;
                        margin-top: 2px; margin-bottom: 0.8em;&#xA;&#xA;
                        text-transform: uppercase;">Oracle </p>
                    </td>
                  </tr>
                </tbody>
              </table>
              <table class=3D"el-item item " style=3D"mso-table-lspace:&#=

                0pt;&#xA; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; border-collapse:&#xA;

                <tbody>
                  <tr>
                    <td style=3D"font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                      -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-ser=

                            border-bottom-style: solid&#xA;&#xA;
                            !important;" moz-do-not-send=3D"true">SQL as
                            an API Language?</a></span> =E2=80=94 Within =
a write
                        up about his <a
                          href=3D"https://dbweekly.com/link/53790/85a4c1e=
dbc"
                          style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:&#xA;
                          #478dda;&#xA; border-bottom-width: 1px&#xA;
                          !important;&#xA; border-bottom-color:
                          #ddd&#xA; !important;&#xA;
                          border-bottom-style: solid&#xA; !important;"
                          moz-do-not-send=3D"true">Datasette</a> project
                        (a tool to create JSON APIs for SQLite
                        databases) Simon reflected on GraphQL=E2=80=99s a=
bility
                        to query data and how SQL could essentially be
                        used for the same thing.</p>
                      <p class=3D"name" style=3D"color: #5a5a5a;&#xA;&#xA=

                            Caching: Oracle vs. Postgres</a></span> =E2=80=

                        Sequence caching is when a database
                        pre-generates sequence values in advance making
                        them quicker to provide when needed.</p>

              <table class=3D"el-item item " style=3D"mso-table-lspace:&#=

                <tbody>
                  <tr>
                    <td style=3D"font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                      -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-ser=

                      font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.55em;&#xA;&#xA;
                      mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace:

                      0px 15px;">
                      <p class=3D"desc" style=3D"font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                        -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-s=
erif;&#xA;&#xA;
                        font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.55em;&#xA;
                        color:&#xA; #5a5a5a; margin-top: 0.8em;&#xA;
                        margin-bottom: 0;"><span
                          style=3D"font-weight:&#xA; 600; font-size:
                          1.1em;&#xA; color: #000;" class=3D"mainlink"><a
href=3D"https://dbweekly.com/link/53798/85a4c1edbc"
                            style=3D"text-decoration: none;
                            color:&#xA;&#xA; #478dda;
                            border-bottom-width: 1px&#xA;&#xA;
                            !important; border-bottom-color:
                            #ddd&#xA;&#xA; !important;
                            border-bottom-style: solid&#xA;&#xA;
                            !important;" moz-do-not-send=3D"true">PL/R: R
                            Procedural Language Support for Postgres</a><=
/span>
                        =E2=80=94 PL/R lets you write Postgres functions =
using
                        R, the popular statistical computing language. A
                        <a
                          href=3D"https://dbweekly.com/link/53799/85a4c1e=
dbc"
                          style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:&#xA;
                          #478dda;&#xA; border-bottom-width: 1px&#xA;
                          !important;&#xA; border-bottom-color:
                          #ddd&#xA; !important;&#xA;
                          border-bottom-style: solid&#xA; !important;"
                          moz-do-not-send=3D"true">new version</a> has
                        just been released which introduces Postgres 11
                        support.</p>
                      <p class=3D"name" style=3D"color: #5a5a5a;&#xA;&#xA=
;
                        font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                        -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-s=
erif;&#xA;&#xA;
                        font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.55em;&#xA;&#xA;
                        margin-top: 2px; margin-bottom: 0.8em;&#xA;&#xA;
                        text-transform: uppercase;">Joseph E. Conway </p>
                    </td>
                  </tr>
                </tbody>
              </table>
              <table class=3D"el-item item " style=3D"mso-table-lspace:&#=
xA;
                0pt;&#xA; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; border-collapse:&#xA;
                collapse;" width=3D"100%" cellspacing=3D"0" cellpadding=3D=
"0">
                <tbody>
                  <tr>
                    <td style=3D"font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                      -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-ser=
if;&#xA;&#xA;
                      font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.55em;&#xA;&#xA;
                      mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace:
                      0pt;&#xA;&#xA; border-collapse: collapse; padding:
                      0px 15px;">
                      <p class=3D"desc" style=3D"font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                        -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-s=
erif;&#xA;&#xA;
                        font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.55em;&#xA;

                            HaloDB, A Fast, Embedded Key-Value Storage
                            Engine Written in Java</a></span></p>
                      <p class=3D"name" style=3D"color: #5a5a5a;&#xA;&#xA=

                        font-family:&#xA;&#xA;
                        -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,Helvetica,sans-s=

                        text-transform: uppercase;">Yahoo Engineering </p=
>
                    </td>
                  </tr>
                </tbody>
              </table>
